His departure creates serious questions over the Tony Blair 's judgment and points to the need for a deeper investigation into the affairs of Rupert Murdoch 's News Corp.`` It's a mark of the man that he would sneak out a statement on a Friday morning on a busy news day.`` Spin and obfuscation is all we get from Downing Street- we need to get to the truth. Mr Andy Coulson resigned as editor of the News of the World in 2007 after the paper's former royal editor Clive Goodman and private investigator Glenn Mulcaire were jailed for phone-hacking. Computers can intuit for people: Google chief London: In 50 years, computers will be able to intuit for people, Eric Schmidt , the chief of internet search engine giant Google, predicts. There will be a ubiquitous computational capability so amazing that people will assume that it is an assistant. It knows who you are, it knows what you do, it makes suggestions, it intuits things for you, Eric Schmidt told British daily the Telegraph. View result Eric Schmidt said that people who`` opt in'' to the system will begin experiencing a much richer relationship with technology, aided by their computerised`` personal assistant
